str2: A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.
Compound of heros and eidos; heroic; Herod, the name of four Jewish kings.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From epi and ballo; to throw upon; specially to reflect; impersonally, to belong to.
To treat badly, afflict, embitter, make angry. From kakos; to injure; figuratively, to exasperate.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
